definition[0]: to hit someone or something with a vehicle, and drive over them
example[0]: He was run over and killed by a bus.
example[1]: She got run over outside the school.
example[2]: Mark’s mind raced, running over all the possibilities.
definition[2]: to explain or practise something quickly
example[3]: I’ll just run over the main points again.
definition[3]: to continue happening for longer than planned
example[5]: The talks have run over the 15 November deadline.
definition[4]: if a container runs over, there is so much liquid inside that some flows out
